sample

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Player represents a player object with name, playerID, current amount of cash on hand, position on current tile it is in, and number of properties, railroad, and utilities it owns. It can purchase, develop, pay rent, and can move.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(java.lang.String n)
      This constructor receives the name of the player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(java.lang.String n)
        This constructor receives the name of the player. It initializes the name, cash, current tile, player value, hasPassed to false, inJail to false and instantiates the space for the arraylist of ownedProperties, ownedRailroads, ownedUtilities, and storedCards.
        Parameters:
        n - is the name of the player to be instantiated as the player object.

    • Method Detail

      • rollDice

        public int rollDice()
        This method lets the player to roll the dice.
        Returns:
        the value of the dice.

      • move

        public void move(int nDice)
        This method moves the players current tile value and sets the hasPassed to true when passes or lands on start.
        Parameters:
        nDice - is the value of the dice.

      • isBankrupt

        public boolean isBankrupt()
        This method returns true if the player is already bankrupt. Bankrupt means the player's cash is less than 0.
        Returns:
        true if bankrupt. Otherwise, return false.

      • ownsTwoColors

        public boolean ownsTwoColors()
        This method returns true when the player owns two or more colors. This is used to update the rent of the properties of the player.
        Returns:
        true if the player owns two or more colors. Otherwise, return false.

      • purchase

        public void purchase(Property prop,
                     Bank bank)
        This method lets the player purchase a property. This also sets the owner of the property to the player who bought the property tile. The bank adds cash depending on the property price, then the player will be deducted cash with regards to how much the property is. Then, it adds the property to the list of the owned properties of the player and it sets the property to isOwned.
        Parameters:
        prop - is the property to be bought.
        bank - is the bank object of the game.

      • purchase

        public void purchase(Utility util,
                     Bank bank)
        This method lets the player purchase a utility. This also sets the owner of the utility to the player who bought the utility. The bank adds cash depending on the utlity price, the the player will be deducted cash with regards to how much the utility is. Then it adds the utility object to the list of owned utilities of the player who bought it.
        Parameters:
        util - is the utility to be bought.
        bank - is the bank object of the game.

      • purchase

        public void purchase(Railroad rail,
                     Bank bank)
        This method lets the player purchase a railroad. This also sets the owner of the railroad to the player who bought the railroad. The bank adds cash depending on the railroad price, the the player will be deducted cash with regards to how much the railroad is. Then it adds the railroad object to the list of owned railroads of the player who bought it.
        Parameters:
        rail - is the railroad to be bought.
        bank - is the bank object of the game.

      • trade

        public void trade(Property prop1,
                  Property prop2,
                  Player propOwner)
        This method lets the player trade properties with another player.
        Parameters:
        prop1 - is the property of the current player who initiates the trade.
        prop2 - is the property of the player of who owns the landed tile.
        propOwner - is the player who owns the landed tile.

      • develop

        public void develop(Property p,
                    Bank bank)
        This method lets the property to be developed when certain conditions are met. This method builds houses up to 4, and then a hotel when fully developed.
        Parameters:
        p - is the property to be developed.
        bank - is the bank object of the game.

      • payRent

        public void payRent(Property prop)
        This method lets the player pay rent when he lands in a property tile. It takes into consideration when to apply double rent.
        Parameters:
        prop - is the property to be paid rent to.

      • payRent

        public void payRent(Utility util,
                    int nDice)
        This method lets the player pay rent when he lands in a utility tile. It takes into consideration the value of the dice.
        Parameters:
        util - is the tile to be paid rent into.
        nDice - is the value of the dice.

      • payRent

        public void payRent(Railroad rail,
                    int nDice)
        This method lets the player pay rent when he lands in a railroad tile. It takes into consideration the value of the dice.
        Parameters:
        rail - is the tile to be paid rent into.
        nDice - is the value of the dice.

                    Bank b,
                    Game g,
                    int dice)

        tiles - is the list of tiles in the board.
        b - is the bank object in the game.
